snippet: The United Nations said it was unable to feed a million hungry residents and aid agencies reported an outbreak of violence in a refugee camp in Jordan.
abstract: New signs of deprivation plaguing Syria's war-ravaged civilians emerge, as United Nations says it is unable to feed a million hungry residents in combat zones and aid agencies report outbreak of violence in refugee camp in Jordan.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and NICK CUMMING-BRUCE
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva. Reporting was contributed by Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem; Ranya Kadri from Amman, Jordan; Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon; and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: The United Nations said it was unable to feed a million hungry residents and aid agencies reported an outbreak of violence in a refugee camp in Jordan.

headline.seo: Aid Groups Report Rising Misery Among Displaced Syrians
headline.main: Aid Groups for Syrians See Needs Growing More Dire
headline.print_headline: Aid Groups for Syrians See Needs Growing More Dire

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
